result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber L. Heieren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Hold Open sentencing on Count 1 on 6/14/17 @ 9am.  DOC shall promptly notify the court, in writing, of any new arrest or criminal charge made againt the deft.

supervisions.notes: Civil judgment entered for unpaid court obligations.

Probation Revoked.
Evidentiary hrg re: Count 1 scheduled for 1/27/17 @ 10am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Carl Johnson.  Defense counsel reports the deft concurs she did not successfully complete the hold open agreement; deft orally agrees on the record that she did not successfully complete the hold open agreement.  Court finds the deft did not complete the hold open agreement.  Deft adjudged guilty on count 1.  Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 1yr.  See conditions.  If revoked, deft requests credit of 17 days.  DNA ordered; written notice given to deft.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
Submitted by Atty Carl Johnson
Atty Carl Johnson

to Revoke Stipulated Hold Open Agreement

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  NMM to Revoke Hold Open on Count 1 filed by the State.  Defense requests a separate hrg be scheduled on this motion but wishes to proceed with the revocation on count 2.  State objects.  Brief discussion held.  Court will proceed with the revocation hrg on count 2 but an evidentiary hrg will be scheduled on count 1.  Sentencing arguments made re: count 2.  Deft sentenced to 30 days KCJ.  Credit for 28 days served.  Civil judgment to be entered for any unpaid financial obligations.  Evidentiary hrg re: count 1 scheduled for 1/27/17 @ 10am.
Revocation Summary from Agent Hewitt.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement - 12 months.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Case is resolved.  Deft agrees to waive her rights to appeal the suppression issue.  Parties have entered into a hold open agreement.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty on Count 2.  Judgment of guilt w/held on count 1.  Sentencing on count 1 scheduled for 6/14/17 @ 9am.  Sentencing arguments made with reference to count 2.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Rocco DeFilippis.  Case is resolved; however, parties still attempting to work out a few details.  Plea hrg set for 6/14/16 @ 10:30am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Matt Perz.  Suppression motion adjourned to 9/24/15 @ 11am due to calendar conflicts (jury trial).

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Matt Perz.  Defense filed a motion to suppress.  Per Court, motion to suppress and ludwig hrg will be heard on the trial date prior to commencing jury selection.
To Suppress - filed by Atty Matt Perz

Defendant, Amber L. Heieren, appeared with Attorney Matthew J. Perz.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Deputy Scifres sworn in and testified; cross examination by Atty Perz. ST moves for bind over; arguments heard; probable cause found, bound over for trial. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered by The Court. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 10:40 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

1:28 pm    Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Matt Perz.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 7-8-15 @ 8:30.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Atty Matthew Perz
